rules: Rule1: Whenever the show is scheduled, it follows that the venue passes inspection or else if it is not the case that (having an emergency exit implies the show does not have a permit), then the venue gets fined.
Rule2: If the show is advertised, then the show is scheduled.
Rule3: Either the show is advertised or the show is rehearsed.
Rule4: If the venue uses a generator, then in the scenario where the venue is not operational, the venue does not have a power outage.
Rule5: Provided that the venue uses a battery backup, then in the event that the venue is not operational, the venue does not have a power outage.
Rule6: If the venue has a backup plan, then the venue is prepared.
Rule7: Provided that the venue uses main power, the venue has electricity.
Rule8: The venue uses main power or has solar panels.
Rule9: If the venue has solar panels, then the venue is operational.
Rule10: If the show starts on time, then the show has an intermission.
Rule11: The show starts on time, or else if it is not the case that (having electricity implies the venue is operational), then the show has a lighting issue.
Rule12: Whenever the show has an intermission, it follows that the show ends on time.
Rule13: If the show is sold out, then the show is at capacity.

Rule14: Under the condition that the band is a headliner, then if the band is popular, if it is not the case that (the show being sold out implies that (if the venue is not operational then the venue has a booking for the band, then the venue does not have a booking conflict)), the show has a scheduling conflict.
Rule15: Either the band is a touring band or the band is not a local band.
Rule16: If the show moves indoors, then the show does not have a weather problem.
Rule17: Provided that the show is postponed, the show does not have a weather problem.
Rule18: Whenever the venue manager checks the forecast, the show moves indoors.
Rule19: If the venue manager consults a meteorologist, then the show is postponed.
Rule20: Provided that the venue manager monitors the radar, the venue manager checks the forecast.
Rule21: Whenever the venue manager checks an app, the venue manager consults a meteorologist.
Rule22: If the venue manager dismisses a warning, then the venue manager ignores the weather.

Rule23: Under the condition that the box office checks ticket sales, then if the show is sold out, if it is not the case that (the venue not being operational implies the venue has a booking for the band), the venue does not have a booking conflict.
Rule24: Either the box office checks ticket sales or updates inventory.
Rule25: Whenever the box office updates inventory, the box office prints tickets.
Rule26: Provided that the box office prints tickets, the box office scans tickets.
Rule27: Whenever the venue has a fire safety certificate, it is not the case that the show has a permit.
Rule28: If the venue hires security, then the venue has crowd control.
Rule29: The venue hires security or does not fail a fire inspection.
Rule30: Provided that the venue manager plans the layout, then the venue uses barricades or does not have crowd control.
Rule31: The venue manager plans the layout or marks sections.
Rule32: If the venue manager marks sections, then the venue manager assigns zones.
Rule33: Under the condition that the venue manager assigns zones, the venue uses barricades or does not have crowd control.
Rule34: Provided that the venue appeals the decision, the venue gets a shutdown order.
Rule35: If the venue issues refunds, then the venue cancels the show.
Rule36: The venue issues refunds or offers a raincheck.
Rule37: Provided that the venue files a lawsuit, the venue wins the case.
Rule38: Whenever the venue files a lawsuit, the venue loses the case.
Rule39: Under the condition that the venue loses the case, the venue does not win the case.
Rule40: The show has a technical difficulty, or else the show has a delayed start or does not start on time.
Rule41: Provided that the tech crew fixes equipment, the tech crew replaces equipment.
Rule42: Whenever the tech crew fixes equipment, it is not the case that the tech crew replaces equipment.
Rule43: The tech crew fixes equipment or the show does not have a technical difficulty.

Rule44: Under the condition that the venue offers a raincheck, then if it is not the case that (the show being at capacity implies that (if the venue is not operational then the venue has a booking for the band, then the venue does not have a booking conflict)), the show requires refunds.

Rule45: The show runner avoids chaos, or else if it is not the case that (following protocol implies (the show runner notifies the audience or else if the show runner adjusts the schedule, then the show runner extends the curfew) then the show runner causes confusion), the show runner maintains order.
Rule46: The show runner keeps the timeline or adjusts the timing.
Rule47: Provided that the show runner adjusts the timing, then if the show starts on time, the show ends on time.

Rule48: Under the condition that the venue manager coordinates staff, then if it is not the case that (keeping the timeline implies that if the show starts on time, the show ends on time), the show runner falls behind schedule.
Rule49: If the venue manager holds a briefing, then the venue manager coordinates staff.
Rule50: The venue manager holds a briefing or sends a memo.
Rule51: Whenever the venue manager sends a memo, the venue manager coordinates staff.

Rule52: Provided that the venue cancels the show, then if it is not the case that (the show being at capacity implies that (if the venue is not operational then the venue has a booking for the band, then the venue does not have a booking conflict)), the show requires refunds.
Rule53: Whenever it is not the case that (if the show is rehearsed, then the show is scheduled), the show is canceled.
Rule54: If it is not the case that (the venue being prepared implies the venue uses a generator or a battery backup), the venue is unprepared.
Rule55: Provided that it is not the case that (having electricity implies the venue is operational), it is not the case that the show has a lighting issue.
Rule56: Under the condition that it is not the case that (the venue manager monitors the radar or checks an app), the venue manager dismisses a warning.
Rule57: Whenever it is not the case that (the venue manager monitors the radar or checks an app), it is not the case that the venue manager ignores the weather.

Rule58: If it is not the case that (the box office scanning tickets implies that if the show is sold out, if it is not the case that (the venue not being operational implies the venue has a booking for the band), the venue does not have a booking conflict), the box office has a ticket error.

Rule59: Provided that it is not the case that (the box office scanning tickets implies that if the show is sold out, if it is not the case that (the venue not being operational implies the venue has a booking for the band), the venue does not have a booking conflict), it is not the case that the box office has a ticket error.

Rule60: Provided that it is not the case that (the show runner keeping the timeline implies that if the show starts on time, the show ends on time), it is not the case that the show runner falls behind schedule.

Rule61: If it is not the case that (it not being the case that (the venue passes inspection or else if it is not the case that (having an emergency exit implies the show does not have a permit) then the venue gets fined) implies the venue appeals the decision), the venue files a lawsuit.

Rule62: Under the condition that it is not the case that (it not being the case that (having electricity implies the venue is operational) implies the show has a lighting issue), the show runner adjusts the schedule.

Rule63: Provided that it is not the case that (it not being the case that (the show being at capacity implies that (if the venue is not operational then the venue has a booking for the band, then the venue does not have a booking conflict)) implies the show requires refunds), the show has a weather problem.

Rule64: If it is not the case that (it not being the case that (the show runner following protocol implies (the show runner notifies the audience or else if the show runner adjusts the schedule, then the show runner extends the curfew)) implies the show runner causes confusion), it is not the case that the show runner maintains order.
Rule65: Under the condition that it is not the case that (the band not being a headliner implies the band is an opening act), the band is a local band.
Rule66: Provided that it is not the case that (the venue not being operational implies the venue has a booking for the band), the venue has a booking conflict.
Rule67: If it is not the case that (the venue not being operational implies the venue has a fire safety certificate), the venue fails a fire inspection.
Rule68: Whenever the venue is not operational, the venue has an emergency exit.
Rule69: If the venue is not operational, then the venue has a power outage.
Rule70: Provided that the venue is not operational, the show has a permit.
facts: Fact1: The venue has a backup plan.
Fact2: The show is sold out.
Fact3: The band is popular.
Fact4: The show runner follows protocol.
Fact5: It is not the case that the venue has a booking for the band.
Fact6: The venue does not get fined.
Fact7: It is not the case that the venue passes inspection.
Fact8: The show is not canceled.
Fact9: The venue is not unprepared.
Fact10: The show does not end on time.
Fact11: The show does not have a scheduling conflict.
Fact12: The band is not an opening act.
Fact13: The band is not a touring band.
Fact14: The show does not require refunds.
Fact15: The venue does not use barricades.
Fact16: The venue does not get a shutdown order.
Fact17: The show does not have a delayed start.
Fact18: The show runner does not extend the curfew.
Fact19: The show runner does not notify the audience.
Fact20: The show runner does not cause confusion.
Fact21: The show runner does not avoid chaos.
